Treatment of locally recurrent small intestine cancer may include the following:         -  Surgery.    -  Radiation therapy or chemotherapy as palliative therapy to relieve symptoms and improve the patient's quality of life.    - A clinical trial of radiation therapy with radiosensitizers, with or without chemotherapy.
